Type.Name: NameValueCollection
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents a collection of associated keys and values.

remarks.para: This class can be used for headers, query strings and form data. Each key in the collection is associated with one or more values. Multiple values for a particular key are contained in a single .
The capacity is the number of key-and-value pairs that the can contain. The default initial capacity is zero. The capacity is automatically increased as required.
The hash code provider dispenses hash codes for keys in the .
The comparer determines whether two keys are equal.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: The new instance is initialized with the default initial capacity, , and .

remarks.para: The capacity, values, and order of values of the new instance are equal to the capacity and values of . The and of the new instance are the default instances.
The elements of the new are sorted in the same order as the source .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection c)

Docs.param: The to copy to the current instance.

summary.para: Copies the entries from the specified to the current instance.

remarks.para: If a key in already exists in the target instance, the associated value in is added to the existing comma-separated list of values associated with the same key in the target instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual void Add(string name, string value)
public virtual void Add (string name, string val);

param.name: name
param.para: A that represents the key of the entry to add. Can be .

summary.para: Adds an entry with the specified key and value to the current instance.

block.para: If the specified key already exists in the current instance, the specified value is added to the existing comma-separated list of values associated with the same key.
Attempting to assign the same value to an existing key adds a new value to that key, thus providing two (or more) copies of the same value associated with the key.

para.block: Override this method to customize the default behavior in a type derived from the current type.
Use this method to add an entry to the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .property class System.String[] AllKeys { public hidebysig virtual specialname class System.String[] get_AllKeys() }

summary.para: Gets all the keys in the current instance.

value.para: A array containing all the keys of the current instance. If the current instance is empty, the value of this property is an empty array.

para.block: The array returned by is cached for better performance and is automatically refreshed when the collection changes. A derived class can invalidate the cached version by calling , thereby forcing the array to be refreshed.

summary.para: Invalidates the cached arrays and removes all entries from the current instance.

remarks.para:
The value of each key and value in the current instance is set to
.
If the current instance is empty, it remains unchanged and no exception is thrown.

exception.para: The number of elements in the current instance is greater than the available space from to the end of the destination .

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Item[int32 index] { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Item(int32 index) }

param.name: index
param.para: A that specifies the zero-based index of the entry to locate in the current instance.

summary.para: Gets the value in the current instance that is associated with the specified index.

value.para: A that contains the comma-separated list of values at the specified index of the current instance.

block.para: This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: myCollection[index].
This property cannot be set. To set the value at a specified index, use Item[GetKey(index)].

Docs.exception: is outside the valid range of indices for the current instance.
The property is being set and the current instance is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Item[string name] { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Item(string name) public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Item(string name, string value) }
public string this[string name] { set; get; }

param.name: name
param.para: A containing the key of the entry to locate.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value in the current instance that is associated with the specified key.

value.para: A that contains the comma-separated list of values associated with the specified key. If is not contained in the current instance, attempting to get it returns , and attempting to set it creates a new entry using .

remarks.para: If the specified key already exists in the collection, setting this property overwrites the existing values with the specified value. (If the existing value contains a string of multiple comma-delimited values, the complete string is replaced with a single instance of the specified value.) If the specified key does not exist in the collection, setting this property creates a new entry using the specified key and the specified value.

block.para: This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the current instance using the following notation: myCollection[key] .
To add the new value to the existing list of values, use the method.

Docs.exception: is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
The property is being set and the current instance is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual void Remove(string name)

Docs.param: A containing the key of the entry to remove from the current instance.

summary.para: Removes the entry with the specified key from the current instance.

para.block:
If is found, the key and its associated value are set to . Removing an element does not alter the capacity of a
.
This method uses the implementation of to locate in the current instance. If is not found in the current instance or is , no exception is thrown and the current instance is unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual void Set(string name, string value)
public virtual void Set (string name, string value);

param.name: name
param.para: A containing the key of the entry to add the new value to.

param.name: value
param.para: A containing the new value to add to the specified entry.

summary.para: Sets the value of the specified entry in the current instance to the specified value.

para.block: If the specified key already exists in the current instance, this method overwrites the existing values with the specified value. (If the existing value contains a string of multiple comma-delimited values, the complete string is replaced with a single instance of value.) If the specified key does not exist in the current instance, this method creates a new entry using the specified key and the specified value.
Use the method to add the new value to the existing list of values.
